About: The USA-NPN Pheno Forecast delivers short-term (6d) threshold-based forecasts of phenological events in plants and pest insects.
hint: Hint: Select a species from the table on the main webpage and look at the forecast images (you can try using the interactive forecast visualizations as well!).

About: A project which is developing a smart water system that integrates novel high-frequency sensors, cyberinfrastructure, and ecosystem forecasting techniques to improve the management of drinking water supply lakes and reservoirs.
hint: Hint: Watch one of the videos under 'In the News' tab to learn more about why this project is making waves in ecological forecast and water management

About: EcoCast is a fisheries sustainability tool that helps fishers and managers evaluate how to allocate fishing effort to optimize the sustainable harvest of target fish while minimizing bycatch of protected or threatened animals.
hint: Hint: Look at both the EcoCast Map and the EcoCast Explorer to customize your forecast visualization and explore different scenarios based on decision-needs

About: This forecast is developed for mature Atlantic Sturgeon using historic telemetry observations matched to date, bathymetry, and sea surface temperature and ocean color from NASA?s MODIS AQUA satellite.
hint: Hint: Look through different dates of forecasts using the 'Select a Date to Update Plot' dropdown to see forecasts with different levels of predicted risk.

About: This project produces ecosystem forecasts informed by citizen reports. They are launching daily forecasts for ticks, jellyfish, and more using data provided by citizens across the country.
hint: Hint: Check out different forecast variables (e.g., tick, jellyfish, moose crash, marine debris) before choosing one for Objectives 1 and 2.

About: This project produceds spatial forecasts of phenological events like when flowers or leaves will appear for a variety of plant species around the US, produced by Shawn Taylor, an ecologist at the University of Florida
hint: Hint: Try the different options for Issue Date, Species, and Phenophase to select a forecast that interests you.

About: An ongoing project to forecast a time series of desert rodent abundances using a long-term historical dataset
hint: Hint: Look at all the different forecast visualizations on the 'Current Forecast' tab before choosing one for Objectives 1 and 2.

About: NOAA's Coral Reef Watch uses remote sensing and models to produce forecasts of coral reef environments worldwide.
hint: Hint: Look at the 'Experimental Products' on the left to see different forecast products.

About: Grass-Cast is an experimental grassland producitivity forecast for the Great Plains region which uses a nearly 40-year historical dataset combined with seasonal precipitation forecasts to predict how rangeland productivity will different from past trends
hint: Hint: Watch the Grass-Cast video under the 'Introductory Video' tab to learn more about the motivations and process behind the Grass-Cast forecasts.

Forecast: Phenology Monitoring at the Morton Aboretum
About: Using forecasted weather data, this project forecasts the probability of bud burst of various types of tree species at the Morton Arboretum in Illinois, USA.
